intro: Shorea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae and is characterized by its hard, dense wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The tree can grow up to 40 meters tall and has elliptical leaves that are typically 5–10 cm long. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in wet and swampy environments.
